data.title: Good food and plenty of it
data.text: The food was good with plenty of it and service was good too, the seafood was fresh and well cooked, but they can't make decent coffee and didn't understand what a Mocca was.

data.title: More pretense than substance, and overpriced
data.text: This place continues to pretend to great food and service, but it's all a veneer. A very pedestrian list of draft beers; overpriced. Lots of expensive fish and steak; not only expensive but oversauced and overflavored. If you must eat here (e.g., because you're with a group), go for something they can't mess up. I got the parmesian crusted chicken ($19) which was actually fairly good.

data.title: Poor Service trumps good food
data.text:
Party of 10 with a reservation on a Saturday night. We were seated promptly. This was the only thing that went right. Our waitress was pleasant, but so unattentive, we sat for long periods with empty water glasses. It was only when/if we asked for more water that we got some. We were seated in a private room. The temperature was sweltering. When we asked about turning the temperature down, we were told the temp was controlled by the attached Biltmore Hotel.
We ordered our food promptly enough. We waited an hour and 15 minutes before our meals arrived. Again, with empty water glasses while waiting.
I will say the food was very good once it arrived, but that could have been because we were THAT hungry.  Our waitress made no apologies, but plenty of excuses.
I do have to comment on one person in our party who has celiacs and MUST Be gluten free. She did order from the gluten free menu, however that evening became sick. If you are gluten free for medical reasons, I would caution you about their food preparation. Obviously there was a mistake made somewhere.
Will not be back. There are plenty of good food choices inProvidence with far better service.

data.title: College prientation
data.text: Fantastic Happy Hour menu and process. The burger was excellent. Good value for happy hour or late night happy hour.

data.title: Huge lunch portions; some of them good. Excellent local craft brew.
data.text: The lunch special at $16 per person consists of a cup of soup or salad and a main dish.  It’s a great deal – it’s about the same price for their sandwiches and burgers a la carte. We had the clam chowder, which was creamy and full of clams: very good.  My main dish was fish and shrimp and chips, with a slaw side.  Enormous serving.  The fish and shrimp were very good: freshly fried: crispy outside and juicy inside.  It came with three sauces, of which one was all right: the horse radish sauce.  The “thousand island” and ketchup were a bit too bland for the tasty fish, as was the slaw.  Although the slaw was nicely crunchy, it could have used more of a flavorful punch.  My husband had the blackened tilapia entrée, which was neither very blackened nor very flavorful, despite the corn relish. While the drink menu does not list individual local craft brews (you have to go down the page to the fine print after the list of draft and bottle beer), I had an excellent porter from Foolproof Brewery (Pawtucket RI) called Raincloud Robust Porter.  Slightly bitter yet smooth walnut.  The service was good, and the location hard to beat since we were staying at the Biltmore Hotel, where it’s located.

data.title: Great resturant conected to a Hotel.
data.text: Had most of my meals here and the food the service and the prices where good. After my second lunch some of the staff remebered me and made we feel very welcomed and rememberd my need for diary free meals.

data.title: As always, GR8 food
data.text: We have, being Landry's Club members, always looked up their sites when we visit a city.  This site, right downtown across from Providence City Hall, was VG.  2 ate for $45, no alcohol.   Crab and corn chowder good, the chopped salad is delicious, and shrimp kisses, although smaller here than in some other cities, were tasty.

data.title: Simply scrumptious!
data.text: My husband and I ate here during our stay in Providence. He is a BIG fan of their "stuffies". I ate their beet salad that was delicious!  I had the almond encrusted rainbow trout and he had their seared scallops!  Both very delicious. We rounded off our meals with the pumpkin cheesecake and their delectable chocolate bag!  You have to try the bag. It is amazing. Our waitress was awesome. We've eaten here before and will definitely eat here again!

data.title: Best Crab Cakes
data.text: I'm a crab cake aficionado; even a snob. I want crab cakes that taste like crab, are made mainly (90% or better) or entirely from crab (by "entirely" I can take a tiny bit of binder, maybe a touch of panko, and s light hand at seasoning). So, when I order crab cakes in my seaside travels, I am always circumspect. To my great and pleasant surprise, these crab cakes were all I expected, and more. Nearly all crab, lightly sauteed, tall, moist, and not overpoweringly seasoned. I'd go back here any time just for their crab cakes.

data.title: Better choice
data.text:
Not sure why people choose to eat at a chain restaurant when they are in cities with such great local ones.  We ate hear because we were in Providence for an over night visit and we using gift cards up.
This is a dated restaurant that could use an upgrade.  It is attached to the historic Biltmore which is an updated Hilton property.

The menu is standard, but had some fall additions which were attractive.  We first ordered an oyster appetizer.  It was tasty but disappointing in that it was warm rather than hot.  
We then ordered a fall entree.  Mine was swordfish, and my partner ordered the salmon.  Both were tasty, but like the appetizer, were served warm rather than hot.

We decided to have the apple pie dessert which I would not recommend.  The desserts are very overpriced for what you get.

data.title: Good food; expensive.
data.text: We ate here while staying at the Biltmore which is next door. Good food, friendly staff but not cheap by European standards.

data.title: Nice New Menu
data.text: The renovations and new menu are nice changes at McCormicks.  Service was good and the restaurant busy.   Will return.

data.title: don't bother
data.text: Dinner may be good - I'll never know. We had breakfast there - service was horrendous and food was not good - neither of us bothered to finish our food, told waitress and hostess and no one really seemed to care.

data.title: Keep away from the bar
data.text: Excellent food and service but I was seated near the entrance to the bar, which was infested with fruit flies, they plagued my meal constantly and one even took a dip in my Riesling!

data.title: Do not be in a hurry for lunch.
data.text: Read some recent reviews , which were not good, and I agree. Not sure if understaffed , but more than the bartender could not multi task. Took over 10 min to get a drink. I ordered clam chowder and chicken Caesar, thinking the chowder would come First, but both came at the same time.  When the salad came , it had no chicken, her answer , well at least, I did not charge you for the chicken. I just would think , when you have a captive audience , you would excel. The food was ok .  I had a friend go in about an hour later, and he said same thing with the day bartender.

data.title: Good place
data.text: They have Happy Hour with great drink & food specials. We sat at the bar, nice bar area. Good bartender, but it seemed she was alone...not good when it got a bit busy and there was a wait for drinks and/or food. Would go again.

data.title: Awful experience
data.text: My family and I went to this restaurant for breakfast at the end of a wonderful vacation. Unfortunately, the experience here ruined the end of our time. We were seated at 9am for breakfast, placed our drink order (which took forever to arrive), then placed our order. We sat for almost an hour and watched tables around us who ordered after us get their food, eat and get their checks. My children became antsy and my husband became furious. Since we had a flight to catch I asked for the check for the drinks and left without ever receiving our order. This was a HORRIBLE experience and the staff only shifted blame instead of offering anything substantial. A lady at an adjacent table, who had two small children of her own, gave me sympathetic eyes and a compassionate smile at what was a very frustrating, humiliating experience. I would tell anyone to go anywhere other than here to eat while in Providence. If I could have given this restaurant a ZERO score that still would've been too high! Try eating somewhere else.

data.title: Run don't walk away
data.text: First you look at the menu on the entrance door. It's different then the one you get inside. Outside the menu is from 16-30. Inside is 28-40. The hostess was found after 5 minutes and we were seated. The gentleman took our order and dropped bread. Well after we got 3 slices of bread they refilled it. Well dinner came 25 minutes later. I got the Parmesan encrusted flounder . It was greasy and had no flavor. The orzo also had no flavor. Green beans hard and tasteless. My husband liked his Tuna . We ordered Brussels sprouts and Potato and they were burnt and hard. We also ordered the maple  Mac and cheese with bacon. That also was greasy and sat heavy all night. We expected a fine dining experience and got less than we get at Long John Silver . Very disappointing.

data.title: Great Breakfast Menu!
data.text:
I typically believe that restaurants in hotels offer breakfast as an afterthought.  Something that they feel obligated to provide for weary travelers who just don't feel like seeking out somewhere better.  This restaurant broke that mold for me.

It was incredible to find things like Chicken and Waffles, Biscuits and Gravy, etc. on the menu.  And, to find them done in exciting new ways.  The Biscuits and Gravy have a parenthetical Death By Pork attached to them, for example.

I had the chicken and waffles. They were excellent.  My heart may never work properly again, but it was worth it.

data.title: Good for a hotel chain
data.text: Good food, ok service, like the consistency of the chain, but not a must go to.  Been a few times and always feel like our server has not been trained properly, but the food is decent.
